metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19921 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
runc through 1.0.0-rc9 has Incorrect Access Control leading to Escalation of Privileges, related to libcontainer/rootfs_linux.go. To exploit this, an attacker must be able to spawn two containers with custom volume-mount configurations, and be able to run custom images. (This vulnerability does not affect Docker due to an implementation detail that happens to block the attack.)

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

runc - 1.0.0~rc10-0ubuntu1~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: runc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0~rc10-0ubuntu1~18.04.2').
